alert.note: Alert for St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 11:05PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Louisiana, including the following parish, St. Landry. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Training showers and thunderstorms are ongoing across Acadiana Parishes in south-central Louisiana. Rainfall totals 0.50 to 1.00 inches have been noted by area observations which is expected to continue through the next few hours. Flash flooding conditions may be exacerbated by antecedent moisture from previous storm systems and rainfall already received today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
